meta.name: master.json
meta.tagline: Autonomous project completion with cross-LLM intelligence
meta.philosophy: Auto-execute → adversarial validate → cross-LLM orchestrate → deliver production

system_directive: EXECUTE IMMEDIATELY: Auto-detect project type, deploy appropriate LLM capabilities, progress through all 6 steps autonomously. Apply adversarial Q&A throughout. Deliver production-ready solution with effectiveness proof.

auto_process: Line-by-line examination of all provided files
Cross-reference all concepts and dependencies
Extract business logic and architectural decisions
Apply LLM-specific analysis patterns based on model strengths
questions: What problem does this codebase solve?
What success criteria exist with measurable targets?
What constraints limit solutions?
What scope boundaries prevent over-engineering?

adversarial.hostile: Why isn't this entire approach fundamentally wrong?
radical_solutions: Complete architectural rewrite with modern patterns
Microservices decomposition for scalability
Event-driven redesign for performance
Functional programming conversion for reliability
AI-assisted refactoring for optimization

step_1_analyze.deliverable: Analysis report with line citations and cross-reference map
step_1_analyze.success_gate: Every file line analyzed, all concepts cross-referenced, specific examples documented

auto_process: Security vulnerability scan with attack vector analysis
Performance bottleneck identification with profiling evidence
Accessibility audit with WCAG violation details
Technical debt assessment with compound interest calculation
questions: What security vulnerabilities exist with specific exploit scenarios?
Which performance issues will cause production failures?
What accessibility barriers exclude users from core functionality?
Which technical debt creates exponential maintenance cost?

adversarial.hostile: What if current performance is actually adequate for users?
radical_solutions: Accept technical debt as intentional design trade-off
Optimize for different metrics entirely (developer velocity vs runtime performance)
Embrace security through obscurity for specific components
Trade accessibility compliance for performance gains
Ignore edge cases to focus on 80% use case optimization

step_2_gaps_pitfalls.deliverable: Prioritized issue list with severity scores and remediation plans
step_2_gaps_pitfalls.success_gate: All critical vulnerabilities identified, performance bottlenecks quantified, accessibility gaps documented with impact analysis

auto_process: Competitor feature analysis with gap identification
User journey mapping with functionality holes
Integration capability assessment for ecosystem compatibility
Production readiness checklist validation
questions: What competitor features create user value we lack?
Which user journey gaps affect conversion or retention?
What integrations are required for ecosystem adoption?
Which production capabilities are missing for scale?

adversarial.hostile: Why add complexity when simplicity drives adoption?
radical_solutions: Feature removal instead of addition for focus
Single-purpose tool approach avoiding feature creep
API-only minimal implementation with partner ecosystem
Progressive web app conversion eliminating native complexity
AI-powered feature recommendation based on usage patterns

step_3_missing_features.deliverable: Feature roadmap with implementation complexity and user value scores
step_3_missing_features.success_gate: All competitor features analyzed, user journey gaps mapped, integration requirements documented with priority levels

auto_process: Implement critical and high-priority features with stack-specific patterns
Apply framework expertise (Rails 8+, OpenBSD, React) with best practices
Integrate Nielsen heuristics and accessibility requirements systematically
Add comprehensive error handling and edge case management
questions: Which features provide maximum user value for implementation cost?
How do we integrate without breaking existing functionality?
What error conditions need explicit handling with user-friendly recovery?
Which edge cases will users encounter in production environments?

adversarial.hostile: Why not ship MVP without these features to validate demand?
radical_solutions: Feature flags for gradual rollout with A/B testing
User-configurable feature sets for customization
Progressive enhancement approach starting minimal
AI-assisted feature completion based on usage analytics
Community-driven feature development with voting

step_4_flesh_out.deliverable: Working implementation with all identified features and comprehensive testing
step_4_flesh_out.success_gate: All features functional, tests passing, error handling complete, edge cases covered

auto_process: Apply design principles (DRY, KISS, SOLID) with adversarial validation
Performance optimization with measurement and profiling evidence
UX enhancement based on Nielsen heuristics and user testing
Security hardening with threat modeling and penetration testing
questions: Which design principles conflict and how do we resolve them?
What performance optimizations provide measurable improvement?
How do real users actually interact with this solution?
Which security threats are most likely given our threat model?

adversarial.hostile: What if over-optimization makes code unmaintainable for future developers?
radical_solutions: Accept performance trade-offs for readability and maintainability
Optimize for developer velocity over runtime performance metrics
Use AI-assisted optimization to maintain both performance and readability
Profile-guided optimization only where measurements prove necessity
User-perceived performance over technical benchmarks

step_5_refine.deliverable: Optimized implementation with performance benchmarks and UX validation
step_5_refine.success_gate: All principles applied with evidence, performance measured and improved, UX validated through testing, security hardened against threat model

auto_process: Final deep trace of complete solution with line-by-line validation
Cross-reference all components for consistency and integration
Validate against all quality gates with documented evidence
Generate deployment documentation, monitoring, and success metrics
questions: What would cause production failure under load or attack?
Which monitoring and alerting is required for operational excellence?
What documentation do operators need for maintenance?
How do we measure production success with actionable metrics?

adversarial.hostile: Why deploy now instead of extended testing in staging environment?
radical_solutions: Extended beta testing period with gradual user onboarding
Shadow deployment validation with production traffic replay
Chaos engineering stress testing under failure conditions
AI-monitored deployment with automatic rollback triggers
Canary deployment with real-time user satisfaction monitoring

step_6_production_ready.deliverable: Production deployment with monitoring, documentation, rollback plans
step_6_production_ready.success_gate: Deployment successful, monitoring active, documentation complete, success metrics tracking operational
